28:10 Mereka sangat menghormati kami dan ketika kami bertolak, mereka menyediakan segala sesuatu yang kami perlukan.

28:10 They also honored us with many honors; and as we put out to sea, they put on board the things for our needs.

 

 

e. Ke Roma, Mengakhiri Perjalanan Kali Keempat

e. To Rome, ending the fourth journey

28:11-31

28:11-31

(1) Ke Roma melalui Sikarusa

(1) Through Syracuse to Rome

28:11-16

28:11-16

 

 

28:11 Tiga bulan kemudian kami berangkat dari situ naik sebuah kapal dari aAleksandria yang selama musim dingin berlabuh di pulau itu. Kapal itu memakai lambang 1bDioskuri.

28:11 And after it had been three months, we put out to sea in an a Alexandrian ship which had wintered in the island, with the 1 twin sons of b Zeus for its figurehead.

28:12 Kami singgah di Sirakusa dan tinggal di situ selama tiga hari.

28:12 And having landed at Syracuse, we remained three days.

28:13 Dari situ kami menyusur pantai, lalu sampai ke Regium. Sehari kemudian bertiuplah angin selatan dan pada hari kedua sampailah kami di Putioli.

28:13 From there we sailed around and arrived at Rhegium. And after one day a south wind came on, and the second day we came to Puteoli,

28:14 Di situ kami berjumpa dengan asaudara-saudara seiman dan atas undangan mereka kami tinggal tujuh hari bersama-sama mereka. Sesudah itu kami berangkat ke Roma.

28:14 Where, having found a brothers, we were urged to remain with them seven days. And thus we came to Rome.

28:15 1Saudara-saudara seiman yang di 2sana telah mendengar kabar tentang kami dan mereka datang menjumpai kami sampai ke 3Forum Apius dan 4Tres Taberne. Ketika Paulus melihat mereka, ia mengucap syukur kepada Allah lalu 5kuatlah hatinya.

28:15 And from 1 there the 2 brothers, having heard about the things concerning us, came as far as the 3 Market of Appius and 4 Three Inns to meet us; and when Paul saw them, he thanked God and 5 took courage.

28:16 Setelah kami tiba di Roma, Paulus diperbolehkan tinggal dalam rumah sendiri bersama-sama seorang prajurit yang amengawalnya.

28:16 And when we entered into Rome, Paul was permitted to remain by himself with the soldier who was a guarding him.

 

 

(2) Kontak dengan Para Pemimpin Agama Yahudi

(2) Contacting the Jewish leaders

28:17-22

28:17-22

 

 

28:17 Tiga hari kemudian Paulus memanggil orang-orang terkemuka bangsa Yahudi dan setelah mereka berkumpul, Paulus berkata, "1Saudara-saudara, meskipun aku atidak melakukan apa pun yang menentang bangsa kita atau badat istiadat nenek moyang kita, namun aku ditangkap di Yerusalem dan diserahkan kepada orang-orang Roma.

28:17 And after three days he called together those who were the leading men of the Jews; and when they came together, he said to them, 1 Men, brothers, though I have done a nothing against the people or the b customs of our fathers, I have been delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans,

28:18 Setelah aku diperiksa, mereka bermaksud amelepaskan aku, karena tidak terdapat suatu kesalahan pun padaku yang bsetimpal dengan hukuman mati.

28:18 Who, having examined me, intended to a release me, because there was not one b cause of death in me.

28:19 Akan tetapi orang-orang Yahudi menentang hal itu dan karena itu terpaksalah aku anaik banding kepada Kaisar, tetapi bukan dengan maksud untuk mengadukan bbangsaku.

28:19 But when the Jews spoke against this, I was compelled to a appeal to Caesar, not that I have anything to accuse my b nation of.

28:20 Itulah sebabnya aku meminta, supaya aku melihat kamu dan berbicara dengan kamu, sebab justru karena apengharapan Israellah aku diikat dengan bbelenggu ini."

28:20 For this cause therefore, I have entreated you to see me and speak with me; for on account of the a hope of Israel I have this b chain around me.

28:21 Akan tetapi mereka berkata kepadanya, "Kami tidak menerima asurat-surat dari Yudea tentang engkau dan juga tidak seorang pun dari saudara-saudara kita datang memberitakan apa-apa yang jahat mengenai engkau.

28:21 And they said to him, We have neither received a letters from Judea concerning you, nor have any of the brothers come and reported or spoken anything evil concerning you.

28:22 Tetapi kami ingin mendengar dari engkau, bagaimana pikiranmu, sebab tentang aaliran ini kami tahu bahwa di mana-mana ada bperlawanan terhadapnya."

28:22 But we think it is fitting to hear from you what you think, for concerning this a sect it is indeed known to us that it is b spoken against everywhere.

 

 

(3) Menunaikan Ministri di Roma

(3) Ministering in Rome

28:23-31

28:23-31

 

 

28:23 Lalu mereka menentukan suatu hari untuk Paulus. Pada hari itu datanglah mereka dalam jumlah besar ke tempat tumpangannya. Ia amenerangkan dan bbersaksi kepada mereka tentang 1cKerajaan Allah; dan berdasarkan hukum dMusa dan kitab para enabi ia berusaha fmeyakinkan mereka tentang Yesus. Hal itu berlangsung dari pagi sampai sore.

28:23 And once they had appointed a day for him, many came to him at his lodging, to whom he a expounded these matters, solemnly b testifying of the 1c kingdom of God and d persuading them concerning Jesus from both the Law of e Moses and the f Prophets, from morning until evening.

28:24 aAda yang dapat diyakinkan oleh perkataannya, ada yang tetap tidak percaya.

28:24 And a some were persuaded by the things which were said, but others did not believe.

28:25 Lalu bubarlah pertemuan itu tanpa ada kesesuaian di antara mereka. Tetapi Paulus masih mengatakan hal yang satu ini, "Tepatlah firman yang disampaikan Roh Kudus kepada nenek moyang kita dengan perantaraan Nabi Yesaya:

28:25 And when they disagreed with one another, they departed, Paul saying one word to them, Well has the Holy Spirit spoken through Isaiah the prophet to your fathers,

28:26 1Pergilah kepada bangsa ini dan katakanlah: Kamu akan mendengar dan mendengar, namun tidak mengerti, kamu akan melihat dan melihat, namun tidak menanggap.

28:26 Saying, 1 Go to this people and say, In hearing you shall hear and by no means understand, and seeing you will see and by no means perceive;

28:27 Sebab ahati bangsa ini telah 1menebal, dan telinganya berat mendengar, dan bmatanya melekat tertutup; supaya jangan mereka melihat dengan matanya dan mendengar dengan telinganya dan mengerti dengan hatinya, lalu berbalik sehingga Aku menyembuhkan mereka.

28:27 For the a heart of this people has become 1 fat, and with their ears they have heard heavily, and their b eyes they have closed, lest they perceive with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their heart, and they turn around, and I will heal them.

28:28 Sebab itu kamu harus tahu bahwa akeselamatan yang berasal dari Allah ini disampaikan kepada bbangsa-bangsa lain dan mereka akan cmendengarnya."

28:28 Let it be known to you therefore that this a salvation of God has been sent to the b Gentiles; they will also c hear it.

28:29 [Setelah Paulus berkata demikian, pergilah orang-orang Yahudi itu dengan banyak perbedaan paham di antara mereka.]

28:29 1 And when he had spoken these things, the Jews departed, having much dispute among themselves.

28:30 Paulus tinggal 1dua tahun penuh di rumah yang disewanya sendiri; ia 2menerima semua orang yang datang kepadanya.

28:30 And he remained 1 two whole years in his own rented dwelling and 2 welcomed all those who came to him,

28:31 1Dengan aterus-terang dan tanpa rintangan apa-apa ia memberitakan 2bKerajaan Allah dan mengajar tentang Tuhan Yesus Kristus.

28:31 1 Proclaiming the 2a kingdom of God and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all b boldness, unhindered.
